name: Samuel Darkwah Manu
intro: Welcome to my portfolio where I display web development, cartography and data science projects I have completed. You may find a few of them below but go to the projects page to see all. — finishing my master at TUM and currently looking for a new role in web development and geoinformatics.
about:
I am multifaceted IT professional with skills cutting across data science, cartography (geoinformatics) and web development. I have expertise in building enterprise level reports and dashboards using Power BI and Tableau, performing analytics with Python libraries and geospatial tools.
 
I have a deep understanding of how the web works and can build fullstack applications with Vue.js, React Node.js/FastAPI/Flask, relational (Postgresql, SQL Server) and non-relational databases (MongoDB).

projects.name: Osmose Statistics
projects.description: This website is a page to give you a summary statistics of issues with your OpenStreetMap contributions as flagged by Osmose.

projects.name: OSM Accessibility Coverage
projects.description: This project visualises the accessibility of physical locations (buildings, shops, transport stations, etc) as a heat map based on OpenStreetMap data

projects.name: Austrian Castles
projects.description: An informative web map displaying castles in Austria. It was originally built with a Geoserver backend. Completed as a group project within the MSc. Cartography programme.

projects.name: nextBin
projects.description: An android mobile application which shows users the nearest waste bins to dispose trash.

projects.name: La Météo
projects.description: A simple weather app that shows the current weather at a user's location.

projects.name: Merchantt
projects.description: A footwear e-commerce app built with Vue.js, Node.js and MongoDB

projects.name: Client App
projects.description: A simple client management CRUD app built with Vue.js, Node.js and MongoDB
